cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles W of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest across the eastern Gulf and then turning north toward the north-central Gulf Coast early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch: Mouth of the Mississippi River to the AL/FL border, incl. Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, Lake Borgne and Mobile Bay.  Hurricane watch: Grand Isle LA to the AL/FL border.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and eastern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are not expected at Charleston; only breezy conditions (below gale force) possible mid- to late week.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the South Carolina coast from Sally.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rainfall (1–2 inches) could arrive late week as the remnant circulation passes inland to the west.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor marine swell increase and rip-current risk late week.
